meanings.definition: People who move slowly or cautiously, especially in a sneaky or suspicious manner.
meanings.sent1: The sidlers crept through the dark alley, trying not to be seen.
meanings.sent2: I saw a group of sidlers walking behind the bushes.
meanings.sent3: The sidlers tip-toed around the corner, looking like they were up to no good.
meanings.sent4: The sidlers moved as quietly as shadows in the night.
meanings.sent5: Beware of the sidlers lurking in the shadows, they might surprise you.

meanings.definition: To move slowly or cautiously, especially in a sneaky or suspicious manner.
meanings.sent1: She sidlers around the house, trying not to make any noise.
meanings.sent2: The cat sidlers towards its prey, ready to pounce.
meanings.sent3: He sidlers into the room, hoping to scare his friend as a prank.
meanings.sent4: The fog sidlers through the streets, enveloping everything in its mist.
meanings.sent5: The spy sidlers past the guards, unnoticed and silent.
